thread.title: Season 7 'The Voice' champion Craig Wayne Boyd rocks Rochester
thread.title_full: Season 7 'The Voice' champion Craig Wayne Boyd rocks Rochester

author: Taj Simmons
title: Season 7 'The Voice' champion Craig Wayne Boyd rocks Rochester
text:
Season 7 'The Voice' champion Craig Wayne Boyd rocks Rochester Posted: tsimmons@kttc.com ROCHESTER, Minn. (KTTC) - 
The Rochester Police Benevolent Association Country Show came to rock the Mayo Civic Center Presentation Hall Sunday evening. The headline act may be a very familiar face to people who watch TV singing competitions. 
Craig Wayne Boyd, winner of season 7 of NBC's "The Voice," was the marquee act. Boyd had a No. 1 country song earlier this year with the song "My Baby's Got A Smile On Her Face." 
Boyd said his life after "The Voice" has been a whirlwind, but that he is grateful to still get to perform on stage every night. 
"That's where I'm myself," said Boyd. "Everywhere else I'm kind of shy and backwards but when I get on stage I'm able to be myself. It's fun." 
The opening act for the concert was the Van Lears. According to court documents, John LaDue will receive treatment for his Autism Spectrum Disorder at a facility, which will be followed by 10 years of heavily supervised probation. More >> Police: Man was selling heroin & meth from SE Rochester home Photo: MGN Online Rochester police identified the man arrested last week on a narcotics warrant in southeast Rochester, and said he had been selling heroin and methamphetamine from the home. Capt. John Sherwin said Maxwell Schafer, 24, is being charged with 3rd degree sales and 5th degree possession of narcotics. Police said a gram of methamphetamine and a small amount of heroin was recovered from Schafer's home at 1252 9th Avenue SE.
